page.title: 13LAW AND ORDER IN LAUGHARNE
page.content: Most of the crime recorded in Laugharne is of a petty nature, with small amounts of shoplifting and theft. Drugs, growing and using, is a small but obviously serious problem. After-hours drinking, rowdiness, fighting and drink-related domestic violence is about average. Motoring offences appear occasionally as do thefts of car badges and joyriding, mostly by youngsters. One fatality occurred as a result of a car crash recently. Vandalism is usually in the form of destruction of trees and playing field equipment but one holiday home had its roof damaged by stones. A policeman is available in Laugharne on Wednesday evenings between 6 and 7 pm for consultation but very little use is made of this service, as it is rather public. Complaints and enquiries go to HQ.
